dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 633 IH: Direct Primary Care Accessibility Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rosendale introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act to exempt certain direct primary care arrangements from regulation as health insurance coverage.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Direct Primary Care Accessibility Act of 2023.

section.header: Exempting certain direct primary care arrangements from regulation as health insurance coverage
section.text: Section 2791(b) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–91(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting , except that such term shall not include a direct primary care arrangement (as defined in paragraph (6)) before the period; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the term direct primary care arrangement means an arrangement under which an item or service is furnished by a health care provider to an individual in return for a direct fee. Such a fee may include—

clause.text: a fee for a service, visit, or episode of care.

subparagraph.text: The term direct primary care arrangement shall not include any arrangement unless—

clause.text: a copy of such arrangement is provided to the individual entering into such agreement (or the legal representative of such individual); and

subclause.text: describes the items and services to be provided in exchange for payment of a direct fee (as described in subparagraph (A));
specifies the direct fee required and any additional fees to be paid by a third party;
specifies the individual’s payment obligation; and
prohibits the provider from charging or receiving additional compensation for items and services included in the direct fee.
